Content.Title: This is BBC FOUR
Content.Synopsis: BBC FOUR is the BBC channel for people who want more. More depth, more range, more to stimulate the mind. More daily from 7.00pm.

Content.Title: James Last: Non-Stop Dancing
Content.Synopsis: James Last is one of the most successful bandleaders and arrangers in the history of popular music. He's loved by the public, why is he so often loathed by the critics?

Content.Title: James Last Live in London
Content.Synopsis: London's Royal Albert Hall comes alive to the happy music sound of James Last and his orchestra. Recorded live in 1977, it's a 'non-stop party' of foot-tapping, hand-clapping, popular easy classics.

Content.Title: Matt Monro: Man With the Golden Voice
Content.Synopsis: This film tells the story of the 'English Sinatra', Terry Parsons, and how he reached lofty heights from a relatively working-class background.

Content.Title: The World of Nat King Cole
Content.Synopsis: Home movies and rare footage help to lift some of the mystique behind the singing legend, widely regarded as one of the first global stars. [S]

Content.Title: New Year's Day Concert from Vienna
Content.Synopsis: Wishing you a very Happy New Year from the Golden Concert Hall of the Musikverein in Vienna, Brian Kay presents a dazzling concert of waltzes, polkas and marches.

Content.Title: Remember the Secret Policeman's Ball?
Content.Synopsis: Another chance to enjoy the Arena documentary that marked the 25th anniversary of Amnesty International's ground-breaking comedy show, The Secret Policeman's Ball. Strong language. [S]

Content.Title: The Quatermass Experiment
Content.Synopsis: Another chance to see this live drama first shown in July, a remake of the 50s classic which caused shockwaves across the nation. With Jason Flemyng, Adrian Dunbar, David Tennant and Mark Gatiss. [S]

Content.Title: Jazz Britannia
Content.Synopsis: 1/3. Stranger on the Shore: How has jazz music, a 20th century African American art form, been assimilated and interpreted by Britain, over the past 60 years? [S]
